alert.note: Alert for Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 3:57PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Jefferson County through 430 PM MDT... At 356 PM MDT, the public reported a strong thunderstorm near Conifer, or 21 miles southwest of Denver, moving south at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Hail may accumulate on roadways causing hazardous travel. Locations impacted include... Conifer and Aspen Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet
